javadoc:
Additional information about {@link Charset java.nio.charset.Charset's} that Ghidra needs to be able to create Ghidra string datatype instances.

See charset_info.xml to specify a custom charset.

methods.javadoc:
Get the global singleton instance of this {@link CharsetInfo}.
@return global singleton instance
methods.name: getInstance
methods.comment: Get the global singleton instance of this CharsetInfo.

methods.name: isBOMCharset

return.comment:
true if the supported multi-byte charset does not specify LE or
         BE

methods.javadoc:
Reinitialize registered Charsets and include user defined Charsets
 specified in charset_info.xml.
methods.name: reinitializeWithUserDefinedCharsets
methods.comment:
Reinitialize registered Charsets and include user defined Charsets
 specified in charset_info.xml.

methods.javadoc:
Register minimal set of Java Charsets to facilitate most test without
 Application initialization overhead.
methods.name: registerStandardCharsets
methods.comment:
Register minimal set of Java Charsets to facilitate most test without
 Application initialization overhead.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an array list of the currently configured charsets.
@return String[] of current configured charsets.
methods.name: getCharsetNames
methods.comment: Returns an array list of the currently configured charsets.

methods.name: getCharsetCharSize
methods.comment:
Returns the number of bytes that the specified charset needs to specify a
 character.

return.comment:
number of bytes in a character, ie. 1, 2, 4, etc, defaults to 1
         if charset is unknown or not specified in config file.

name: CharsetInfo
comment:
Additional information about Charset that
 Ghidra needs to be able to create Ghidra string datatype instances.
 
 See charset_info.xml to specify a custom charset.
